intro: Cyclophorus subvelutinus, commonly known as the velvetleaf cyclophorus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, this plant thrives in humid, well-drained soils. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and clearings. The plant's unique morphology and ecological adaptability make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
